doc.field: Village of Jamaica, Queens County temperance collection
Village of Jamaica, Queens County temperance collection

This collection consists of 1833 meeting minutes and constitution of the Temperance Society of School District No. 4 in the Village of Jamaica, Queens County and an 1855 petition to the village's Board of Trustees requesting an increase in the number of police officers to combat the problems of "intemperance and profanity."

This collection consists of 1833 meeting minutes and constitution of the Temperance Society of School District No. 4 in the Village of Jamaica, Queens County and an 1855 petition to the village's Board of Trustees requesting an increase in the number of police officers to combat the problems of "intemperance and profanity."

This collection consists of the meeting minutes and constitution of the Temperance Society of School District No. 4 in the Village of Jamaica, Queens County, dating from 1833, and a petition to the Board of Trustees of the Village of Jamaica from its residents requesting an increase in the number of police officers to combat the problems of "intemperance and profanity," dated 1855.
Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.
